name: Eiffel Tower
description: Iconic iron lattice tower
estimated_duration_hours: a symbol of Paris and France.

name: Louvre Museum
description: World's largest art museum
estimated_duration_hours: home to the Mona Lisa and vast collections.

name: Notre Dame Cathedral
description: Medieval Catholic cathedral

name: Arc de Triomphe
description: Triumphal arch honouring those who fought for France

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces housed in a former railway station.

name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
description: Stunning white basilica offering one of the best views of Paris.

name: Palace of Versailles
description: Former royal residence known for its opulence

name: Luxembourg Gardens
description: Beautiful public park with statues
cost_level: and a popular spot for leisure.

name: Champs-Élysées
description: Famous avenue known for luxury shops

name: Montmartre
description: Historic district known for its artistic heritage

name: Seine River Cruise
description: Enjoy panoramic views of Parisian landmarks from the Seine River.

name: Latin Quarter
description: Vibrant student area with historic streets

name: Le Marais
description: Trendy historic district with boutiques

name: Père Lachaise Cemetery
description: Famous cemetery
estimated_duration_hours: final resting place of many notable figures like Oscar Wilde and Jim Morrison.

name: Pont Neuf
description: Paris's oldest standing bridge

name: Cité des Sciences et de l'Industrie
description: Large interactive science museum in La Villette park

name: Disneyland Paris
description: Popular theme park east of Paris

name: Marché des Enfants Rouges
description: Paris's oldest covered market
estimated_duration_hours: offering diverse food stalls and fresh produce.

name: Catacombs of Paris
description: Underground ossuaries holding the remains of millions of Parisians.

name: Palais Garnier (Opera House)
description: Grand 19th-century opera house
estimated_duration_hours: known for its opulent design and as inspiration for Phantom of the Opera.

name: Place des Vosges
description: Paris's oldest planned square

name: Musée Rodin
description: Museum dedicated to the works of sculptor Auguste Rodin

name: Centre Pompidou
description: High-tech architectural building housing the National Museum of Modern Art.

name: Rue Mouffetard Market
description: Lively street market in the Latin Quarter
estimated_duration_hours: great for fresh produce and local treats.

name: Musée de l'Orangerie
description: Home to Monet's "Water Lilies" murals and other Impressionist works.

name: Colosseum
description: Ancient amphitheater

name: Roman Forum
description: Ruins of the center of ancient Roman public life.

name: Trevi Fountain
description: Baroque fountain

name: Vatican City
description: Independent city-state
estimated_duration_hours: home to St. Peter's Basilica and Vatican Museums.
